elements.title: UK Net Zero Carbon Buildings Standard
elements.description: The UK Net Zero Carbon Buildings Standard will enable industry to robustly prove their built assets are net zero carbon, joined by  industry organisations BBP, BRE, the Carbon Trust, CIBSE, IStructE, LETI, RIBA, RICS, and UKGBC. This is the method underlying the new SAP / RdSAP 11 Standard Assessment Procedure for EPC

elements.title: Standard Assessment Procedure
elements.description: Guidance on how a home's energy performance is calculated using the Standard Assessment Procedure (SAP) methodology, which underpins the Energy Performance Certificate (EPC). The new SAP / RdSAP 11 (scoped by [Etude](https://www.etude.co.uk/news/the-future-of-sap-calculations/) and [brought forward by BRE](https://www.edie.net/uk-to-revamp-methodology-that-measures-energy-performance-of-uk-homes/)) will come into force in 2025, alongside the Future Homes Standard update of the Building Regulations.

elements.title: CalTrack
elements.description: CalTRACK specifies a set of empirically tested methods to standardize the way normalized meter-based changes in energy consumption are measured and reported. When CalTRACK is implemented through open source software, these methods can be used to support procurement of energy efficiency, electrification, and other distributed energy resources. Check [eemeter](http://eemeter.openee.io/)

elements.title: MCS
elements.description: MCS is a standards organisation. They create and maintain standards that allows for the certification of products, installers and their installations. In [Nov 2021](https://www.solarpowerportal.co.uk/news/mcs_launches_battery_installation_standard_in_bid_to_provide_one_stop_shop) they have launched [MIS 3012](https://mcscertified.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/MIS-3012_Battery-Storage-Systems-V0.1.pdf) the first battery installation standard, detailing requirements for MCS certified installers

elements.title: Reset
elements.description: RESET is a set of standards and assessment tools & services to develop actionable, long term strategies towards health and sustainability for the built environment. They have started with air quality, with the aim of expanding to energy, materials, water, etc.

elements.title: Brick
elements.description: Brick is an open-source effort to standardize semantic descriptions of the physical, logical and virtual assets in buildings and the relationships between them.

elements.title: Google Digital Buildings Project
elements.description: The Digital Buildings project is an open-source, Apache-licensed effort to create a uniform schema and toolset for representing structured information about buildings and building-installed equipment. Check [Episode 56 of Nexuslabs podcast](https://www.nexuslabs.online/-056-sabine-lam-unpacks-googles-building/) a conversation with Sabine Lam, Google's Building Operating System Global Lead for Real Estate and Workplace Services.

elements.title: Matter Protocol
elements.description: The Connectivity Standards Alliance ([CSA](https://csa-iot.org/)), formerly known as the Zigbee Alliance announced Matter – the interoperable, secure connectivity standard for the future of the smart home. [In the news, May 2021](https://zigbeealliance.org/news_and_articles/chip-is-now-matter/)

elements.title: The green deal
elements.description: Green deal (expired 2014) [link](https://www.gov.uk/green-deal-energy-saving-measures)

elements.title: Green button data
elements.description: The [Green Button initiative](https://www.greenbuttonalliance.org/about) is an industry-led effort to respond to a White House call-to-action to provide electricity customers with easy access to their energy usage data in a consumer-friendly and computer-friendly format.

elements.title: BREEAM
elements.description: BREEAM world’s leading sustainability assessment method + certification for masterplanning projects, infrastructure and buildings.

elements.title: stroma certification
elements.description: stroma certification for epc, gas, etc...

elements.title: microgeneration
elements.description: microgeneration quality certification supported by BEIS

elements.title: EPC register
elements.description: Energy Performance Certificate EPC register there’s also a data set here: [London domestic efficiency by boroughs](https://data.london.gov.uk/dataset/domestic-energy-efficiency-ratings-borough)

elements.title: TERRE
elements.description: TERRE is the Trans European Replacement Reserves Exchange. From what I understood companies like Flexitricity or any other PPA can use this protocol to provide demand side response with a 15' cycle time. Have no idea how they implement it though.

elements.title: Streamlined energy and carbon reporting - SECR
elements.description: Streamlined energy and carbon reporting - SECR released Oct '17 and updated mid '18 gives guidelines for mandatory carbon reporting framework for UK big businesses, as well as directions for energy efficiency

elements.title: ESOS
elements.description: ESOS is a mandatory energy assessment scheme for organisations in the UK that meet the qualification criteria established to implement Article 8 (4 to 6) of the [EU Energy Efficiency Directive (2012/27/EU)](http://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=OJ:L:2012:315:0001:0056:EN:PDF)

elements.title: Ashrae
elements.description: Ashrae was formed as the American Society of Heating, Refrigerating and Air-Conditioning Engineers and publishes a standard for high efficency and low carbon heating and ventilation

elements.title: KNX
elements.description: KNX develop and promote the KNX standard so that it is recognised as the basis for creating Smart home and building solutions

elements.title: Project Haystack
elements.description: Project Haystack is an open source initiative to streamline working with data from the Internet of Things. Haystack standardize semantic data models and web services with the goal of making it easier to unlock value from the vast quantity of data being generated by the smart devices

elements.title: European Energy Flexibility Platform and Interface (EF-PI)
elements.description: European Energy Flexibility Platform and Interface (EF-PI)  - [link docs](http://fpai-ci.sensorlab.tno.nl/builds/fpai-documentation/development/html/) not really a standard, more a consortium of private companies trying to adopt a common toolset.

elements.title: IEEE P825
elements.description: IEEE P825  - Guide for Interoperability of Transactive Energy Systems with Electric Power Infrastructure

elements.title: SMETS2
elements.description: SMETS2 smart meter specs v2 adopted by UK

elements.title: ISO 50001
elements.description: ISO 50001 supports organizations in all sectors to use energy more efficiently, through the development of an energy management system

elements.title: ENTSOE
elements.description: ENTSOE European Network of Transmission System Operators for Electricity, represents 43 electricity transmission system operators (TSOs) from 36 countries across Europe. The integration of renewables into the power system requires for their intermittency to be balanced. This can be tackled by electricity grids operating smartly and cost-efficiently.

elements.title: ICAIEC
elements.description: the International Centre for AI and Climate Change will advise governments on best practice regulation and facilitate the application of AI technology to energy and climate challenges.
